page.text: United Nations
S
Distr.: General
13 October 2005
Original: English

text.b: Official communiqué of the 5279th (closed) meeting of the
Held in private at Headquarters, New York, on Thursday,

page.text: In accordance with rule 55 of the provisional rules of procedure of the Security
Council, the following communiqué was issued through the Secretary-General in
place of a verbatim record:
"At its 5279th meeting, held in private on 13 October 2005, the Security
Council considered the item entitled `The situation in Côte d'Ivoire'.
"The President recalled the invitation extended under rule 37 of the
Council's provisional rules of procedure to His Excellency Mr. Oluyemi
Adeniji, Minister for Foreign Affairs of Nigeria, as well as invitations
extended under rule 39 of the Council's provisional rules of procedure to His
Excellency Mr. Said Djinnit, the Commissioner of the African Union
Commission, Mr. Pierre Schori, Special Representative of the Secretary-
General for Côte d'Ivoire and to Mr. António Monteiro, High Representative
of the Secretary-General for the elections in Côte d'Ivoire.
"Members of the Council exchanged views with the aforementioned
invitees."
